p: Parkinson's disease (PD) is a neurodegenerative disorder that is characterized by motor dysfunction but also causes nonmotor deficits [ 1]. Although the etiology of PD remains unclear, the interaction between genetic and environmental factors has been implicated in the emergence of the disease [ 2, 3]. Genome-wide association studies (GWAS) have identified variants of many candidate genes that contribute to PD susceptibility, such as variations of the SNCA gene [ 4â€“ 6]. Moreover, certain polymorphisms of SNCA are among the major risk factors for sporadic PD [ 5].
